conclusion: To determine if the direction of Car A's acceleration changes, analyze the v-t graph of Car A.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, determined by the slope of the v-t graph.
The graph for Car A consists of two identical arcs, indicating a symmetric change in velocity over time.
The slope of the v-t graph represents acceleration; positive slope indicates positive acceleration, negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
In the first part of the graph (0 to 2 seconds), the slope is positive, indicating Car A is accelerating.
In the second part of the graph (2 to 4 seconds), the slope is negative, indicating Car A is decelerating.
Since the slope changes from positive to negative at 2 seconds, the direction of Car A's acceleration changes.
The direction of Car A's acceleration changes within the time interval of 0 to 4 seconds.
